meanings.definition: Having a full, rounded shape; chubby or fat.
meanings.sent1: The cat ate so much that it became the plumpest in the litter.
meanings.sent2: The plumpest pumpkin in the patch won the contest.
meanings.sent3: The plumpest squirrel in the park was the envy of all the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks were the plumpest apples on the tree of faces.
meanings.sent5: The plumpest clouds in the sky looked like fluffy pillows.

meanings.definition: To make or become plump or full in form.
meanings.sent1: She fed the birds well to plumpest them before winter.
meanings.sent2: The baker added extra yeast to plumpest the dough.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand could plumpest anything it touched.
meanings.sent4: The gardener's special fertilizer helped plumpest the roses quickly.
meanings.sent5: The chef knew just the right ingredients to plumpest the souffle.

meanings.definition: The superlative form of plump, meaning the most full or rounded in shape.
meanings.sent1: Among the pumpkins, the plumpest was awarded first place.
meanings.sent2: The plumpest of the fruits was saved for the king's feast.
meanings.sent3: The plumpest of the clouds cast the biggest shadow on the field.
meanings.sent4: In the garden, the plumpest of the tomatoes was the juiciest.
meanings.sent5: The plumpest of the balloons soared highest in the sky.
